description: GraphQuery.find_symbol no longer finds symbols by partial name match — only exact matches work.
GraphQuery.who_calls returns containment relationships instead of call relationships — asking who calls a function returns its parent class instead.
GraphBuilder accumulates stale nodes and edges when build_from_directory is called multiple times — the second build has duplicate symbols from the first.

mutation.original:
# Reset state so reusing a builder doesn't accumulate stale data
        self.graph = nx.DiGraph()
        self._file_hashes = {}
        self._unresolved = []
mutation.mutated:
# Reset state so reusing a builder doesn't accumulate stale data
        # self.graph = nx.DiGraph()
        # self._file_hashes = {}
        # self._unresolved = []

description: GraphQuery.get_file_symbols always returns an empty list — it cannot find any file nodes in the graph.
ContextStrategy.SMART has the wrong string value — code that checks strategy == "smart" fails silently.
detect_language returns "python3" instead of "python" for .py files, causing the parser to fail to select the correct Python parser.
Default LLM provider is set to openai instead of anthropic, breaking configurations that rely on the anthropic default.
Default agent max_iterations is set to 150 instead of 15, allowing runaway agent loops that waste API credits.
Function call edges in the graph use kind 'invokes' instead of 'calls'. The RelKind.CALLS enum value was changed, so all call graph queries (who_calls, what_calls) return empty results.
GraphQuery.what_calls filters by containment edges instead of call edges — it returns child symbols instead of callees.
GraphQuery.impact_of always reports the symbol as not found, even when it exists in the graph. The return dict has found=False regardless of whether find_symbol matches.
